==Japanese==
[[File:RYAKUJI ki.png|thumb|right|100px|{{w|Ryakuji}} for 器.]]

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=4|rs=口13}}

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|goon=[[き]] (ki)
|kanon=[[き]] (ki)
|kun=[[うつわ]] (utsuwa)
}}

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=o|き}}
From {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=き}} {{m|zh|器|tr=khij<sup>H</sup>||vessel; instrument}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=o|き}}
* When used as a suffix, the resulting term has a [[downstep]] either right before, or one [[mora]] before, the ''ki''.
:* If the preceding syllable has only one mora (as in ''ga'' or ''tsu''), the downstep occurs just after that mora:
::: {{m|ja|瓦器||unglazed earthenware}}: {{ja-accent/down|が}}{{lang|ja|き}} <span class="Latn"><tt>[gáꜜkì]</tt></span>
::: {{m|ja|空気予熱器|tr=kūki yonetsuki||air pre-heater}}: {{lang|ja|く}}{{ja-accent/high|うきよね}}{{ja-accent/down|つ}}{{lang|ja|き}} <span class="Latn"><tt>[kùúkí yónétsúꜜkì]</tt></span>
:* If the preceding syllable has two [[morae]] (as in ''zen'' or ''tei''), the downstep occurs between the two morae:
::: {{l|ja|安全器|tr=anzenki||safety cut-out}}: {{lang|ja|あ}}{{ja-accent/high|ん}}{{ja-accent/down|ぜ}}{{lang|ja|んき}} <span class="Latn"><tt>[àńzéꜜǹkì]</tt></span>
::: {{l|ja|円弧測定器|tr=enko sokuteiki||cyclometer}}: {{lang|ja|え}}{{ja-accent/high|んこそく}}{{ja-accent/down|て}}{{lang|ja|いき}} <span class="Latn"><tt>[èńkó sókútéꜜèkì]</tt></span>

====Affix====
{{ja-pos|affix|き}}

# [[device]], [[instrument]]
# [[container]], [[vessel]]

=====Usage notes=====
Often used interchangeably with {{m|ja|機|tr=ki}} in compounds to indicate “machine”, with the subtlety that {{lang|ja|器}} implies a smaller device, perhaps hand-held, while {{ja-l|機}} implies a larger machine, such as an airplane. Compare {{m|ja|食器|tr=shokki||tableware}} and {{m|ja|飛行機|tr=hikōki||airplane}}, or [[homophone]]s {{m|ja|機械|tr=kikai||machine|pos=generally larger}} and {{m|ja|器械|tr=kikai||machine, tool|pos=generally smaller}}.

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|器械|きかい}}: [[device]], [[machine]] {{qualifier|generally smaller}}
* {{ja-r|食器|しょっき}}: [[tableware]]
* {{ja-r|茶器|ちゃき}}: [[teaware]]
* {{ja-r|茗器|めいき}}: [[teaware]]
{{der-bottom}}

====Suffix====
{{ja-pos|suffix|き}}

# [[device]], [[instrument]]

=====Usage notes=====
Can attach to various nouns that can be used as verbs, to indicate a device for carrying out the action. Examples:
* {{m|ja|計量|tr=keiryō||measurement, measuring, gauging}} + {{m|ja|器|tr=-ki}} = {{m|ja|計量器|tr=keiryōki||a measuring device, a gauge}}
* {{m|ja|尿|tr=nyō||urine}} + {{m|ja|器|tr=-ki}} = {{m|ja|尿器|tr=nyōki||urinal}}
* {{m|ja|印字|tr=inji||print, type|lit=stamp + character}} + {{m|ja|器|tr=-ki}} = {{m|ja|印字器|tr=injiki||a printer|pos=a smaller device, such as a handheld number and letter puncher}}

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|計量器|けいりょうき}}: a [[measuring]] [[device]], a [[gauge]]
* {{ja-r|尿器|にょうき}}: a [[urinal]]
* {{ja-r|印字器|いんじき}}: a [[printer]] {{qualifier|a smaller device, such as a handheld number and letter puncher}}
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|うつわ}}
{{IPAchar|/ut͡supa/}} → {{IPAchar|/ut͡suɸa/}} → {{IPAchar|/ut͡suwa/}}

From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=うつわ}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref> Cognate with {{m|ja|空|tr=utsuo|pos=ancient ''utsupo'', ''utsubo''}}, signifying a {{m|en|hollowness}}. Appears to be a compound of {{m|ja|空}}, {{m|ja|内|tr=utsu||hollow|pos=combining form, standalone form ''uchi'', “inside”}} + {{m|ja|は|tr=ha}}. The derivation of this ''ha'' element is unclear.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|うつわ|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|うつわ|hhira=うつは}}

# [[container]], [[vessel]]
# a [[tool]], a [[utensil]]
# one's [[degree]] of [[ability]]: [[talent]], [[caliber]]
# [[female]] [[genitalia]]: a [[vagina]]

=====Derived terms=====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|器物|うつわもの}}: a [[container]]; [[ability]], [[talent]]; a [[musical instrument]]
{{der-bottom}}

{{der-bottom}}
